rev.diff:
Line 181: Line 181:
Collins reported [[hearing impairment|losing his hearing]] in his right ear in 2000 due to a viral infection. In September 2009, it was reported that Collins could no longer play drums, due to a recent operation to repair dislocated vertebrae in his neck.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1212596/I-play-drums-says-Phil-Collins.html |title=I can never play the drums again, says Phil Collins | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=9 November 2009 |accessdate=1 January 2010 | location=London}}</ref>
Collins reported [[hearing impairment|losing his hearing]] in his right ear in 2000 due to a viral infection. In September 2009, it was reported that Collins could no longer play drums, due to a recent operation to repair dislocated vertebrae in his neck.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1212596/I-play-drums-says-Phil-Collins.html |title=I can never play the drums again, says Phil Collins | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=9 November 2009 |accessdate=1 January 2010 | location=London}}</ref>
However, a statement from Collins on the Genesis band website said, "There isn't any drama regarding my 'disability' and playing drums. Somehow during the last Genesis tour I dislocated some vertebrae in my upper neck and that affected my hands. After a successful operation on my neck, my hands still can't function normally. Maybe in a year or so it will change, but for now it is impossible for me to play drums or piano. I am not in any 'distressed' state, stuff happens in life."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.genesis-music.com/news/news.php?uid=466 |title=Official Site for Genesis - join now for exclusives! news.news |publisher=Genesis-music.com |date= |accessdate=1 January 2010}}</ref>
However, a statement from Collins on the Genesis band website said, "There isn't any drama regarding my 'disability' and playing drums. Somehow during the last Genesis tour I dislocated some vertebrae in my upper neck and that affected my hands. After a successful operation on my neck, my hands still can't function normally. Maybe in a year or so it will change, but for now it is impossible for me to play drums or piano. I am not in any 'distressed' state, stuff happens in life."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.genesis-music.com/news/news.php?uid=466 |title=Official Site for Genesis - join now for exclusives! news.news |publisher=Genesis-music.com |date= |accessdate=1 January 2010}}</ref>
  +   +
Citing health problems, Collins announced in March of 2011 that he is ending is music career. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.bbcamerica.com/anglophenia/2011/03/04/phil-collins-ending-music-career-says-he-wont-be-missed/ | title=Phil Collins Ending Music Career, Says He Wonât Be Missed | publisher=BBC |date=4 March 2011 | accessdate=4 March 2011}}</ref>
